perturbation.original_text: Within [***] after execution thereof, Distributor shall provide Zogenix with a full and complete copy of each Sub- distributor agreement (provided that Distributor may redact any confidential information contained therein that is not relevant to compliance with this Agreement).
perturbation.changed_text: Within [***] after execution thereof, Distributor will never provide Zogenix with a full and complete copy of each Sub- distributor agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts legal and ethical obligations regarding transparency and compliance. By preventing Zogenix from receiving sub-distributor agreements, it hinders Zogenix's ability to ensure compliance with anti-corruption laws (like FCPA) and contractual obligations, potentially leading to legal liabilities. This lack of transparency violates the duty of good faith and fair dealing implied in most contracts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: FCPA (Foreign Corrupt Practices Act), general contract law principles of good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: Within [***] after the end of each Fiscal Year, starting with the Fiscal Year in which the First Commercial Sale occurs, Distributor shall deliver to Zogenix a report setting forth: (A) the total Net Sales of the Product in the Territory during such Fiscal Year, (B) the detailed and total deductions from gross amounts invoiced to arrive at such Net Sales, (C) the number of units of the Product sold in the Territory during such Fiscal Year, (D) the gross amounts invoiced for such sales, (E) the calculation of actual Net Price for such Fiscal Year, (F) the total amount invoiced by Zogenix and paid by Distributor to Zogenix under the Supply Agreement for the total number of units of the Product ordered by and delivered to Distributor during such Fiscal Year, based on the estimated Net Price for such Fiscal Year, (G) the total amount actually owed to Zogenix for the total number of units of the Product ordered by and delivered to Distributor during such Fiscal Year based on the actual Net Price and (H) the difference between the amounts in clauses (F) and (G) (each such report, an "Annual Report").
perturbation.changed_text: Distributor is never obligated to deliver to Zogenix a report setting forth: (A) the total Net Sales of the Product in the Territory during such Fiscal Year, (B) the detailed and total deductions from gross amounts invoiced to arrive at such Net Sales, (C) the number of units of the Product sold in the Territory during such Fiscal Year, (D) the gross amounts invoiced for such sales, (E) the calculation of actual Net Price for such Fiscal Year, (F) the total amount invoiced by Zogenix and paid by Distributor to Zogenix under the Supply Agreement for the total number of units of the Product ordered by and delivered to Distributor during such Fiscal Year, based on the estimated Net Price for such Fiscal Year, (G) the total amount actually owed to Zogenix for the total number of units of the Product ordered by and delivered to Distributor during such Fiscal Year based on the actual Net Price and (H) the difference between the amounts in clauses (F) and (G) (each such report, an "Annual Report").
perturbation.explanation: This change eliminates the distributor's obligation to provide sales reports, making royalty calculations impossible and breaches the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing. Under the Japan GAAP and IFRS, failure to report financial data accurately can also lead to legal issues regarding financial transparency.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Japan GAAP, IFRS, general contract law principles of good faith and fair dealing

perturbation.original_text: Except to the extent expressly authorized by this Agreement or otherwise agreed in writing by the Parties, the Parties agree that during the Term and for [***] thereafter, the receiving Party (the "Receiving Party") shall keep confidential and shall not publish or otherwise disclose or use for any purpose other than as provided for in this Agreement or the Supply Agreement any Information or materials furnished to it or its Affiliates by or on behalf of the other Party (the "Disclosing Party") or its Affiliates pursuant to this Agreement, the Supply Agreement, the Confidentiality Agreement or any other written agreement between the Parties or their Affiliates, in any form (written, oral, photographic, electronic, magnetic, or otherwise), including all information concerning the Product and any other technical or business information of whatever nature (collectively, "Confidential Information" of the Disclosing Party).
perturbation.changed_text: There should not be a need to keep confidentiality of information. Each party should be free to disclose all information as they see fit.
perturbation.explanation: By eliminating the confidentiality clause entirely, this change creates several legal contradictions. It voids trade secret protection (Uniform Trade Secrets Act), potentially infringes on patent rights, and nullifies contractual obligations to protect proprietary information, leading to potential legal challenges.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Trade Secrets Act, patent law, general contract law regarding confidentiality
